sentence.Network_en: an auspicious start to the new school year
The publication of my first book was an auspicious beginning of my career.
sentence.Network_cn: 我的第一本书的出版是我事业吉祥的开始.

sentence.Network_en: His career as a playwright had an auspicious start.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的剧作家生涯有了一个好的开头。

entry.def: Something that is auspicious indicates that success is likely.

example.ex: His career as a playwright had an auspicious start.
example.tran: 他的剧作家生涯有了一个好的开头。

means.word_mean: 2. tending to favor or bring good luck;

sentences.sentence: "a favorable time to ask for a raise"
"a prosperous moment to make a decision"

stems_affixes.word_buile: con大家+spic看+uous……的→大家都看见→显眼的
de向下+spic看+able能……的→能向下看的→可鄙视的
per全部+spic看+acious多……的→全部看到→独具慧眼
sus下面+spic看+ious……的→在下面看的→suspicious怀疑的
suspicious[adj.[of]可疑的,多疑的,疑心的]+ly表副词→adv.猜疑着, 怀疑着
sus下面+spic看+ion表名词→在下面看→suspicion怀疑

stems_affixes.value_cn: 不管, 尽管, 不论
stems_affixes.word_buile: de去掉+spite=spic看→不看→不管, 尽管

有利的,吉利的,有帮助的
